items.title: Venezuela denounces ‘colonialist threat’ as Trump orders airspace closed
items.standfirst: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’The Venezuelan government has responded defiantly to the heightened pressure by the US government, including Donald Trump’s recent statements on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law. The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...
items.content: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’The Venezuelan government has responded defiantly to the heightened pressure by the US government, including Donald Trump’s recent statements on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.In a statement, the Venezuelan government said Trump’s comments are a “colonialist threat” against their sovereignty and violate international law. The government also said it demanded respect for its airspace and would not accept foreign orders or threats. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says Venezuela airspace should be considered closed, Caracas slams 'colonialist threat'
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump on Saturday warned that the airspace above and around Venezuela should be considered closed, escalating tensions with Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro as Washington steps up a major military deployment in the Caribbean and strikes on alleged drug-smuggling vessels. Caracas slammed the warning as a "colonialist threat".
items.content: President Donald Trump on Saturday warned that the airspace above and around Venezuela should be considered closed, escalating tensions with Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro as Washington steps up a major military deployment in the Caribbean and strikes on alleged drug-smuggling vessels. Caracas slammed the warning as a "colonialist threat".

items.title: At least three killed in Russian drone and missile strikes on Ukraine
items.standfirst: Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukraine's capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said. The Kyiv City Military Administration said two people were killed in the strikes on the capital, and a woman died, and eight were wounded in a combined missile and drone attack on the broader Kyiv region, according to the regional police.
items.content: Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukraine's capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said. The Kyiv City Military Administration said two people were killed in the strikes on the capital, and a woman died, and eight were wounded in a combined missile and drone attack on the broader Kyiv region, according to the regional police.

items.title: Russia pounds Ukraine with deadly strikes as peace negotiations enter crucial stage
items.standfirst: Russia attacked Kyiv in a deadly drone attack early Saturday, officials said. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced that he's sent an envoy to the U.S. to continue peace negotiations.
items.content: Russia attacked Kyiv in a deadly drone attack early Saturday, officials said. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced that he's sent an envoy to the U.S. to continue peace negotiations.

items.title: Zelenskyy faces ‘mini-revolution’ as Yermak’s fall reshapes Ukraine’s wartime power system
items.standfirst: Exit of Zelenskyy’s most powerful aide could also have impact on Kyiv’s negotiating position in talks over ending warUkraine’s political system is bracing for a “mini-revolution” as the county’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, is forced to adapt to life without his closest adviser, chief enforcer and most loyal associate, Andriy Yermak, who resigned on Friday after his apartment was searched as part of a widening anti-corruption probe.Yermak’s resignation could have tremendous consequences for domestic governance, as well as for Ukraine’s negotiating position in talks over ending the war with Russia, where he had served as the head of Ukraine’s delegation to peace talks with the White House. Continue reading...
items.content: Exit of Zelenskyy’s most powerful aide could also have impact on Kyiv’s negotiating position in talks over ending warUkraine’s political system is bracing for a “mini-revolution” as the county’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, is forced to adapt to life without his closest adviser, chief enforcer and most loyal associate, Andriy Yermak, who resigned on Friday after his apartment was searched as part of a widening anti-corruption probe.Yermak’s resignation could have tremendous consequences for domestic governance, as well as for Ukraine’s negotiating position in talks over ending the war with Russia, where he had served as the head of Ukraine’s delegation to peace talks with the White House. Continue reading...

items.content: Just as peace talks were gaining traction, Ukraine has lost its lead negotiator

items.title: Fall of Zelensky's top aide - reboot for Kyiv or costly shake-up?
items.standfirst: A widening corruption scandal forced Ukraine's second most powerful person, Andriy Yermak, to resign.
items.content: A widening corruption scandal forced Ukraine's second most powerful person, Andriy Yermak, to resign.

items.title: Zelensky removes top aide and negotiator after anti-graft raids
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky removed his powerful chief of staff and top negotiator on Friday, after detectives raided Andriy Yermak's house as part of a sweeping corruption probe. Yermak's removal deals a serious blow to Zelensky, who faces a mounting Russian offensive in the east as Washington peddles a plan to end the war that Kyiv fears will hand big concessions to Moscow.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky removed his powerful chief of staff and top negotiator on Friday, after detectives raided Andriy Yermak's house as part of a sweeping corruption probe. Yermak's removal deals a serious blow to Zelensky, who faces a mounting Russian offensive in the east as Washington peddles a plan to end the war that Kyiv fears will hand big concessions to Moscow.

items.title: What we know about resignation of top Ukraine official
items.standfirst: President Zelenskyy’s chief of staff has resigned after investigators searched his home amid a corruption scandal.
items.content: President Zelenskyy’s chief of staff has resigned after investigators searched his home amid a corruption scandal.

items.title: Macron to host Zelensky for talks in Paris on Monday
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will visit French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris on Monday, said the French presidential office, as the US pushes a plan to end the war between Moscow and Kyiv. Meanwhile, Ukraine used drones to attack two "shadow fleet" tankers, believed to be covertly transporting sanctioned Russian oil, a Ukrainian security official said Saturday. Read about the day’s events as they unfolded on our liveblog.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will visit French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris on Monday, said the French presidential office, as the US pushes a plan to end the war between Moscow and Kyiv. Meanwhile, Ukraine used drones to attack two "shadow fleet" tankers, believed to be covertly transporting sanctioned Russian oil, a Ukrainian security official said Saturday. Read about the day’s events as they unfolded on our liveblog.

items.title: Zelenskyy’s top aide quits after anti-corruption searches of his home
items.standfirst: Ukrainian president announces departure of Andriy Yermak, who was leading peace talks with USVolodymyr Zelenskyy’s powerful chief of staff and closest ally, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies conducted searches at his apartment earlier today.The abrupt departure of the aide, who had been leading the latest round of the delicate peace negotiations with the US, was announced by the Ukrainian president in a late-afternoon social media video on Friday. Continue reading...
items.content: Ukrainian president announces departure of Andriy Yermak, who was leading peace talks with USVolodymyr Zelenskyy’s powerful chief of staff and closest ally, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies conducted searches at his apartment earlier today.The abrupt departure of the aide, who had been leading the latest round of the delicate peace negotiations with the US, was announced by the Ukrainian president in a late-afternoon social media video on Friday. Continue reading...

items.title: Top Zelenskyy aide at heart of U.S. peace talks resigns after being implicated in corruption probe
items.standfirst: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks resigned on Friday after being thrust into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia’s war
items.content: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks resigned on Friday after being thrust into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia’s war

Zelenskyy sent an envoy to the US to continue peace negotiations.
A top aide, Andriy Yermak, resigned after an anti-corruption raid.
Ukrainian forces attacked Russian vessels with naval drones in the Black Sea.

clusters.title: Playwright and "Shakespeare in Love" screenwriter Tom Stoppard dies at 88
clusters.neutral_headline: Tom Stoppard, Acclaimed Playwright, Dies at 88

items.title: Playwright and "Shakespeare in Love" screenwriter Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.standfirst: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation.
items.content: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation.

items.title: Tom Stoppard, playwright of dazzling wit and playful erudition, dies aged 88
items.standfirst: A theatrical sensation since the 1960s, whose dramas included Arcadia, The Real Thing and Leopoldstadt, Stoppard also had huge success as a screenwriterTom Stoppard: a life in picturesMichael Billington: ‘A brilliant dramatist who always raised the temperature of the room’The playwright Tom Stoppard, whose playful erudition dazzled the theatregoing world for decades, has died aged 88.On Saturday, United Agents said Stoppard died at home in Dorset, surrounded by his family. They paid tribute to the “brilliance and humanity” of his work and “his wit, his irreverence, his generosity of spirit and his profound love of the English language”. Continue reading...
items.content: A theatrical sensation since the 1960s, whose dramas included Arcadia, The Real Thing and Leopoldstadt, Stoppard also had huge success as a screenwriterTom Stoppard: a life in picturesMichael Billington: ‘A brilliant dramatist who always raised the temperature of the room’The playwright Tom Stoppard, whose playful erudition dazzled the theatregoing world for decades, has died aged 88.On Saturday, United Agents said Stoppard died at home in Dorset, surrounded by his family. They paid tribute to the “brilliance and humanity” of his work and “his wit, his irreverence, his generosity of spirit and his profound love of the English language”. Continue reading...

items.title: Tom Stoppard, Award-Winning Playwright, Dies at 88
items.standfirst: British playwright Tom Stoppard, widely regarded as one of the greatest dramatists of his generation, has died at age 88. His literary agency, United Agents, announced Saturday that Stoppard died peacefully at his home in Dorset, southern England, surrounded by family. The Czech-born writer won…

items.title: Tom Stoppard, celebrated British playwright, dies aged 88
items.standfirst: Stoppard's writing, often philosophical or scientific but consistently funny, gave rise to the term Stoppardian.
items.content: Stoppard's writing, often philosophical or scientific but consistently funny, gave rise to the term Stoppardian.

items.title: Acclaimed British playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.standfirst: British playwright Tom Stoppard, who won an Academy Award for the screenplay for 1998’s “Shakespeare In Love” has died. He was 88.
items.content: British playwright Tom Stoppard, who won an Academy Award for the screenplay for 1998’s “Shakespeare In Love” has died. He was 88.

items.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
items.standfirst: Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.
items.content: Arcadia, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead and The Coast of Utopia. He also wrote screenplays for Brazil and Shakespeare in Love. He's pictured above in London in 2017.'/>Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.(Image credit: Justin Tallis/WPA Pool)

items.title: Sir Tom Stoppard: Witty and playful writer who took ideas seriously
items.standfirst: He was an award-winning playwright whose works delighted generations.
items.content: He was an award-winning playwright whose works delighted generations.

ai_summary: Tom Stoppard, a celebrated British playwright, died at the age of 88.
He won an Academy Award for the screenplay of "Shakespeare In Love."
Stoppard's writing style was often described as philosophical and funny.
His literary agency announced his peaceful passing at home in Dorset.
Stoppard's works include "Arcadia" and "The Real Thing."

clusters.title: Authorities probe corruption and negligence in Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades

items.title: Authorities probe corruption and negligence in Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades
Authorities probe corruption and negligence in deadly Hong Kong apartment fire
items.standfirst: Hong Kong’s deadliest fire in decades has raised questions about corruption and negligence in the renovations of the apartment complex where at least 128 people died.
items.content: Hong Kong’s deadliest fire in decades has raised questions about corruption and negligence in the renovations of the apartment complex where at least 128 people died.

items.title: Three days of mourning begin after Hong Kong's deadliest fire in decades
items.standfirst: At least 128 people have died and hundreds remain unaccounted for following the fire which engulfed several tower blocks.
items.content: At least 128 people have died and hundreds remain unaccounted for following the fire which engulfed several tower blocks.

items.title: Hong Kong mourns victims of deadly building fire
items.standfirst: An outpouring of grief swept Hong Kong on Saturday as thousands paid their respects and laid flowers for the 128 people killed in one of the city's deadliest fires, marking the start of an official, three-day mourning period. People from across the city flocked to a small park near the charred shell of Wang Fuk Court, the residential complex that burned for more than 40 hours, to place white and yellow flowers and leave handwritten messages of remembrance.
items.content: An outpouring of grief swept Hong Kong on Saturday as thousands paid their respects and laid flowers for the 128 people killed in one of the city's deadliest fires, marking the start of an official, three-day mourning period. People from across the city flocked to a small park near the charred shell of Wang Fuk Court, the residential complex that burned for more than 40 hours, to place white and yellow flowers and leave handwritten messages of remembrance.

items.title: Hong Kong begins three-day mourning period after deadly high-rise fire
items.standfirst: Hong Kong began a three-day mourning period, after at least 128 people were killed in fires at a high-rise complex.
items.content: Hong Kong began a three-day mourning period, after at least 128 people were killed in fires at a high-rise complex.

items.title: Hong Kong mourns victims of blaze as search for remains continues
items.standfirst: At least 128 people died and 150 remain missing after the towers housing 4,600 people were engulfed by flames.
items.content: At least 128 people died and 150 remain missing after the towers housing 4,600 people were engulfed by flames.

items.title: Hong Kong begins three days of mourning after deadly apartment fires
items.standfirst: Families are combing hospitals hoping to find their loved ones as about 200 people still listed as missing, and at least 128 killedAn outpouring of grief was set to sweep Hong Kong on Saturday as an official, three-day mourning period began with a moment of silence for the 128 people killed in one of the city’s deadliest fires.City leader John Lee, along with senior ministers and dozens of top civil servants, stood in silence for three minutes on Saturday morning outside the government headquarters, where the flags of China and Hong Kong were flown at half-mast. Continue reading...
items.content: Families are combing hospitals hoping to find their loved ones as about 200 people still listed as missing, and at least 128 killedAn outpouring of grief was set to sweep Hong Kong on Saturday as an official, three-day mourning period began with a moment of silence for the 128 people killed in one of the city’s deadliest fires.City leader John Lee, along with senior ministers and dozens of top civil servants, stood in silence for three minutes on Saturday morning outside the government headquarters, where the flags of China and Hong Kong were flown at half-mast. Continue reading...

items.title: Rescue efforts end at Hong Kong tower block fire as death toll reaches 128
items.standfirst: About 200 people still unaccounted for, say officials, as fire chief confirms no alarms went off in any of the eight towersAnger swells in Hong Kong over deadliest fire in more than 70 yearsHow the Hong Kong fire unfolded – visual guideThe death toll from the Hong Kong apartment complex fire that began on Wednesday has risen to 128 with as many as 200 missing, officials have said, as rescue operations were declared over.Firefighters had been combing through the high-rises on Friday, attempting to find anyone alive after the massive fire that spread to seven of eight towers in one of the city’s deadliest blazes. Continue reading...

items.title: Hong Kong fire death toll rises to 128, with 200 still missing and 8 more arrested
items.standfirst: HONG KONG — The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing estate in Hong Kong has killed at least 128 people, authorities said Friday, with some 200 people still missing and eight more arrested
items.content: HONG KONG — The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing estate in Hong Kong has killed at least 128 people, authorities said Friday, with some 200 people still missing and eight more arrested

ai_summary: At least 128 people died in the deadliest fire in Hong Kong in decades.
Authorities are probing corruption and negligence related to the fire.
A three-day mourning period began with a moment of silence.
Hundreds remain unaccounted for after the fire.
Families are searching for loved ones in hospitals.

items.title: Airlines worldwide work to fix software glitch on A320 aircraft
items.standfirst: Airlines around the world reported short-term disruptions heading into the weekend as they fixed software on the widely used A320 family of aircraft. FRANCE 24 speaks to Anita Mendiratta, strategic advisor, author and diplomat specialising in tourism and aviation to better understand the situation.
items.content: Airlines around the world reported short-term disruptions heading into the weekend as they fixed software on the widely used A320 family of aircraft. FRANCE 24 speaks to Anita Mendiratta, strategic advisor, author and diplomat specialising in tourism and aviation to better understand the situation.

items.title: Airlines rush to fix Airbus A320 software glitch, disruptions reported
items.standfirst: Airlines worldwide on Saturday rushed to fix software on hundreds of Airbus A320s after a JetBlue jet’s sudden altitude drop exposed a solar radiation-linked glitch. There were short-term disruptions at several airports as US passengers prepared to return home after the Thanksgiving holiday, one of the busiest travel times in the country.
items.content: Airlines worldwide on Saturday rushed to fix software on hundreds of Airbus A320s after a JetBlue jet’s sudden altitude drop exposed a solar radiation-linked glitch. There were short-term disruptions at several airports as US passengers prepared to return home after the Thanksgiving holiday, one of the busiest travel times in the country.

items.title: Airbus issues major A320 recall after mid-air incident grounds planes, disrupting global travel
items.standfirst: Immediate software change on ‘significant number’ of jets to result in disruption to half the worldwide fleetAirlines around the world cancelled and delayed flights heading into the weekend after Airbus announced on Friday that it had ordered immediate repairs to 6,000 of its A320 family of jets in a recall affecting more than half of the global fleet.The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA), which is the main certifying authority for A320 aircraft, issued the instruction on Friday night as a precautionary action, saying that “safety is paramount”. Continue reading...
items.content: Immediate software change on ‘significant number’ of jets to result in disruption to half the worldwide fleetAirlines around the world cancelled and delayed flights heading into the weekend after Airbus announced on Friday that it had ordered immediate repairs to 6,000 of its A320 family of jets in a recall affecting more than half of the global fleet.The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA), which is the main certifying authority for A320 aircraft, issued the instruction on Friday night as a precautionary action, saying that “safety is paramount”. Continue reading...

items.title: Airbus rush to update A320 software after plane's sudden altitude drop
items.standfirst: Airlines around the world canceled and delayed flights heading into the weekend to fix software on a widely used commercial aircraft after an analysis found the computer code may have contributed to a sudden drop in the altitude of a JetBlue plane last month. Airbus said Friday that an examination of the JetBlue incident revealed that intense solar radiation may corrupt data critical to the functioning of flight controls on the A320 family of aircraft.
items.content: Airlines around the world canceled and delayed flights heading into the weekend to fix software on a widely used commercial aircraft after an analysis found the computer code may have contributed to a sudden drop in the altitude of a JetBlue plane last month. Airbus said Friday that an examination of the JetBlue incident revealed that intense solar radiation may corrupt data critical to the functioning of flight controls on the A320 family of aircraft.

items.title: Airbus Warns A320 Fleet Needs Software Fix After Incident
items.standfirst: Airbus SE cautioned that more than half of its active A320 jetliner family fleet will need a software fix after a recent incident involving a JetBlue Airways Corp. airliner revealed that “intense solar radiation” could corrupt data that helps maintain functioning flight controls.
items.content: Airbus SE cautioned that more than half of its active A320 jetliner family fleet will need a software fix after a recent incident involving a JetBlue Airways Corp. airliner revealed that “intense solar radiation” could corrupt data that helps maintain functioning flight controls.

ai_summary: Airlines worldwide are fixing software on the A320 family of aircraft.
Airbus recommended an emergency software update for the A320 aircraft.
"Intense solar radiation" may have corrupted flight systems, Airbus said.
Thousands of Airbus planes were grounded due to a software glitch.
The Pope's flight was also affected by the Airbus software fix.

clusters.title: Tens of thousands march across Europe in show of support for Palestinians
clusters.neutral_headline: Gaza Death Toll Surpasses 70,000 Amid Ongoing Conflict

items.title: Tens of thousands march across Europe in show of support for Palestinians
items.standfirst: Tens of thousands rallied in Paris on Saturday to show support for Palestinians in Gaza, as protesters accused Israel of violating a fragile US-brokered ceasefire and demanded tougher international action amid soaring death tolls and ongoing restrictions on aid. Gaza’s health ministry, run by Hamas, said Saturday that more than 70,000 people have been killed since the war began.
items.content: Tens of thousands rallied in Paris on Saturday to show support for Palestinians in Gaza, as protesters accused Israel of violating a fragile US-brokered ceasefire and demanded tougher international action amid soaring death tolls and ongoing restrictions on aid. Gaza’s health ministry, run by Hamas, said Saturday that more than 70,000 people have been killed since the war began.

items.title: Gaza death toll surpasses 70,000, says health ministry
items.standfirst: Two Palestinian children reportedly killed on Saturday as Israel continues its strikes after latest ceasefireThe Palestinian death toll has surpassed 70,000 since the Israel-Gaza war began, Gaza’s health ministry said on Saturday, while a hospital reported Israeli fire killed two Palestinian children in the territory’s south.The toll has continued to rise after the latest ceasefire took effect on 10 October. Israel still carries out strikes in response to what it has called violations of the truce, and bodies from earlier in the war are being recovered from the rubble. Continue reading...
items.content: Two Palestinian children reportedly killed on Saturday as Israel continues its strikes after latest ceasefireThe Palestinian death toll has surpassed 70,000 since the Israel-Gaza war began, Gaza’s health ministry said on Saturday, while a hospital reported Israeli fire killed two Palestinian children in the territory’s south.The toll has continued to rise after the latest ceasefire took effect on 10 October. Israel still carries out strikes in response to what it has called violations of the truce, and bodies from earlier in the war are being recovered from the rubble. Continue reading...

items.content: The Palestinian death toll has surpassed 70,000 since the Israel-Hamas war began, Gaza’s Health Ministry said Saturday, while a hospital said that Israeli fire killed two Palestinian children in the territory's south.

items.title: Trump threatens migrants after National Guard shooting
items.standfirst: President Trump announced a series of immigration actions after the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday. Those actions include pausing all current asylum decisions and reviewing all green card holders from 19 "countries of concern."
items.content: President Trump announced a series of immigration actions after the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday. Those actions include pausing all current asylum decisions and reviewing all green card holders from 19 "countries of concern."

items.title: Trump vows permanent pause on migration from 'third world countries' after D.C. shooting
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he will “permanently pause” all immigration from what he called “third world countries” and demanded a program of “reverse migration” as he intensified his rhetoric after the National Guard shooting in Washington, D.C.Trump offered few details as he disparaged and vowed to remove millions of migrants in the U.S. in a lengthy social media post late on Thanksgiving that came hours after he confirmed the death of National Guard soldier Sarah Bec
items.content: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he will “permanently pause” all immigration from what he called “third world countries” and demanded a program of “reverse migration” as he intensified his rhetoric after the National Guard shooting in Washington, D.C.Trump offered few details as he disparaged and vowed to remove millions of migrants in the U.S. in a lengthy social media post late on Thanksgiving that came hours after he confirmed the death of National Guard soldier Sarah Bec

clusters.title: Pope visits Istanbul’s Blue Mosque without praying as he focuses on Christian unity
clusters.neutral_headline: Pope Leo Visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque

items.title: Pope visits Istanbul’s Blue Mosque without praying as he focuses on Christian unity
items.standfirst: Pope Leo XIV visited Istanbul’s iconic Blue Mosque on Saturday but didn't stop to pray, as he focused more on bolstering ties with Orthodox patriarchs and promoting courageous steps for Eastern and Western churches to be united.
items.content: Pope Leo XIV visited Istanbul’s iconic Blue Mosque on Saturday but didn't stop to pray, as he focused more on bolstering ties with Orthodox patriarchs and promoting courageous steps for Eastern and Western churches to be united.

items.standfirst: The pope is visiting Turkiye until Sunday on his first overseas trip as pontiff, which also includes a visit to Lebanon.
items.content: The pope is visiting Turkiye until Sunday on his first overseas trip as pontiff, which also includes a visit to Lebanon.

items.title: Pope Leo visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque

items.content: The Head of the Catholic Church, Pope Leo, visited Istanbul's Blue Mosque as part of his four-day trip to Turkiye.

items.content: The Pope has visited Istanbul's Blue Mosque during a day spent meeting both Muslim and Christian leaders.

items.title: Pope visits Blue Mosque, then holds mass in Istanbul
items.standfirst: Thousands of worshippers battled the rain to join Pope Leo XIV as he celebrated mass in Istanbul on Saturday, the last full day of his visit to Turkey. Pope Leo also visited Istanbul's iconic Blue Mosque, removing his shoes out of respect but not appearing to pray. Leo later prayed with the spiritual leader of the world’s Orthodox Christians, Patriarch Bartholomew, at the patriarchal church of Saint George.
items.content: Thousands of worshippers battled the rain to join Pope Leo XIV as he celebrated mass in Istanbul on Saturday, the last full day of his visit to Turkey. Pope Leo also visited Istanbul's iconic Blue Mosque, removing his shoes out of respect but not appearing to pray. Leo later prayed with the spiritual leader of the world’s Orthodox Christians, Patriarch Bartholomew, at the patriarchal church of Saint George.

items.title: Trump casts long shadow over Honduran politics ahead of vote
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Friday made a major intervention into Honduran politics days before the Central American nation votes, pardoning a convicted ex-leader and threatening to cut US support if his preferred candidate loses. Trump said he will pardon ex-president Juan Orlando Hernandez, who was convicted last year in a US court of drug trafficking charges and sentenced to 45 years in prison.

items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Friday he will pardon former Honduran leader Juan Orlando Hernández, who was extradited to the United States and is serving a drug-trafficking sentence. The ruling party’s presidential candidate for Sunday’s election accused Washington of interfering in the vote.

Continue reading...

items.title: Major winter storm impacts post-Thanksgiving travel for millions
items.standfirst: Storm warnings and advisories extended from Montana to New York, the National Weather Service said.
items.content: Storm warnings and advisories extended from Montana to New York, the National Weather Service said.

ai_summary: A major winter storm is impacting travel for millions after Thanksgiving.
The storm is expected to spread through the Midwest and Great Lakes regions.
The National Weather Service issued warnings for widespread heavy snowfall.
Hazardous travel conditions are anticipated due to the winter storm.
Storm warnings and advisories extend from Montana to New York.

clusters.title: Russian attack on Ukraine kills six as Kyiv envoys travel to US for talks
clusters.neutral_headline: Russian attacks on Ukraine kill six, injure dozens

items.title: Russian attack on Ukraine kills six as Kyiv envoys travel to US for talks
items.standfirst: Widescale Russian attack on Ukraine kills six, injures dozens, as Kyiv seeks US support for a resolution to the war.
items.content: Widescale Russian attack on Ukraine kills six, injures dozens, as Kyiv seeks US support for a resolution to the war.

items.title: Russian strikes cause power outages for more than 600,000 in Ukraine
items.standfirst: The overnight attack kills at least three and injures dozens more.
items.content: The overnight attack kills at least three and injures dozens more.

ai_summary: A Russian attack on Ukraine resulted in six deaths and dozens of injuries.
Kyiv envoys are traveling to the United States for discussions.
The overnight attack caused power outages for over 600,000 people.
At least three people died in the overnight attack, with many injured.
Ukraine is seeking U.S. support for a resolution to the war.

clusters.title: Flights returning to normal after Airbus warning grounded planes
clusters.neutral_headline: Flights returning to normal after Airbus grounding warning

items.title: Flights returning to normal after Airbus warning grounded planes
items.standfirst: Around 6,000 planes were affected after an issue that could corrupt data was discovered.
items.content: Around 6,000 planes were affected after an issue that could corrupt data was discovered.

items.title: Flights returning to normal after Airbus grounding warning
items.standfirst: Passengers in the UK are being assured there will only be minimal disruption over the weekend following a software issue affecting thousands of Airbus planes.
items.content: Passengers in the UK are being assured there will only be minimal disruption over the weekend following a software issue affecting thousands of Airbus planes.

ai_summary: Flights are returning to normal after an Airbus grounding warning.
Around 6,000 planes were affected by a data corruption issue.
Passengers in the UK are assured minimal disruption over the weekend.
A software issue affected thousands of Airbus planes globally.
The issue was discovered, prompting the grounding of affected aircraft.
